metadata.title: CVE-2018-10851 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
PowerDNS Authoritative Server 3.3.0 up to 4.1.4 excluding 4.1.5 and 4.0.6,and PowerDNS Recursor 3.2 up to 4.1.4 excluding 4.1.5 and 4.0.9, arevulnerable to a memory leak while parsing malformed records that can leadto remote denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10851` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pdns-backend-bind - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-geoip - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-ldap - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-lua - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-mydns - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-mysql - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-odbc - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-opendbx - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-pgsql - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-pipe - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-remote - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-sqlite3 - 4.2.1
pdns-backend-tinydns - 4.2.1
pdns-server - 4.2.1
pdns-tools - 4.2.1
No subscription required

pdns-recursor - 4.2.0-6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pdns package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.1').
pdns-recursor package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-6').
